content.description: Start with a left hand undercling and a right hand crimp behind your head. Jump to a side pull and then a jug and top out.
content.protection: A pad or two with a spotter is nice
content.location: Walk back from hourglass and you will see the obvious chalked roof. This climb starts on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Start on a big left side pull and a right hand undercling. Make right hand compression moves along another large side pull with a jug at the top. Bring your left hand in and to another jug next to the right hand. Grab a right hand crimp and top out on jugs. Height dependent but still goes for the shorties.
content.location: The left side of the interstellar boulder

content.description: Start on a right hand slot jug and a large left hand jug and work your way up the arete to get to the “hourglass pinch” for which the problem is named. Climb up on good holds and top out.
content.protection: 4 pads and good spotters for the top
content.location: At the end of the cliff band with a campfire on top

content.description: Start at the bottom of the roof matched on a jug and go left then up through some compression moves to 2 jugs and top out on good holds. It’s probably 6 feet tall to the victory jug.
content.location: This climb in located on the interstellar boulder at the bottom of the roof

pathTokens: McGee Creek Natural Scenic Recreation Area

content.description: A sandstone cliff band of mostly choss with a few gems
